params.amount0Max: the maximum amount of token0 msg.sender willing to input
params.amount0Min: the minimum amount of token0 actually input (slippage protection)
params.amount1Max: the maximum amount of token1 msg.sender willing to input
params.amount1Min: the minimum amount of token1 actually input (slippage protection)
params.pool: address of G-UNI pool to add liquidity to
params.receiver: account to receive minted G-UNI tokens

returns.amount0: amount of token0 transferred from msg.sender to mint `mintAmount`
returns.amount1: amount of token1 transferred from msg.sender to mint `mintAmount`
returns.mintAmount: amount of G-UNI tokens minted and transferred to `receiver`

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

rebalanceAndAddLiquidity(address,uint256.details: because router performs a swap on behalf of msg.sender and slippage is possible some value unused in mint can be returned to msg.sender in token0 and token1 make sure to consult return values or measure balance changes after a rebalanceAndAddLiquidity call.

params.amount0In: the amount of token0 msg.sender forwards to router
params.amount0Min: the minimum amount of token0 actually deposited (slippage protection)
params.amount1In: the amount of token1 msg.sender forwards to router
params.amount1Min: the minimum amount of token1 actually deposited (slippage protection)
params.pool: address of G-UNI pool to add liquidity to
params.receiver: account to receive minted G-UNI tokens
params.swapAmount: the amount of token to swap
params.swapThreshold: the slippage parameter of the swap as a min or max sqrtPriceX96
params.zeroForOne: Which token to swap (true = token0, false = token1)

returns.amount0: amount of token0 actually deposited into pool
returns.amount1: amount of token1 actually deposited into pool
returns.mintAmount: amount of G-UNI tokens minted and transferred to `receiver`

params.amount0Min: Minimum amount of token0 received after burn (slippage protection)
params.amount1Min: Minimum amount of token1 received after burn (slippage protection)
params.burnAmount: The number of G-UNI tokens to burn
params.receiver: The account to receive the underlying amounts of token0 and token1

returns.amount0: actual amount of token0 transferred to receiver for burning `burnAmount`
returns.amount1: actual amount of token1 transferred to receiver for burning `burnAmount`
returns.liquidityBurned: amount of liquidity removed from the underlying Uniswap V3 position

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

addLiquidity(address,uint256,uint256,uin.notice: addLiquidity adds liquidity to G-UNI pool of interest (mints G-UNI LP tokens)

addLiquidityETH(address,uint256,uint256,.notice: addLiquidityETH same as addLiquidity but expects ETH transfers (instead of WETH)

rebalanceAndAddLiquidity(address,uint256.notice: rebalanceAndAddLiquidity accomplishes same task as addLiquidity/addLiquidityETH but msg.sender rebalances their holdings (performs a swap) before adding liquidity.

rebalanceAndAddLiquidityETH(address,uint.notice: rebalanceAndAddLiquidityETH same as rebalanceAndAddLiquidity except this function expects ETH transfer (instead of WETH)

removeLiquidity(address,uint256,uint256,.notice: removeLiquidity removes liquidity from a G-UNI pool and burns G-UNI LP tokens

removeLiquidityETH(address,uint256,uint2.notice: removeLiquidityETH same as removeLiquidity except this function unwraps WETH and sends ETH to receiver account

uniswapV3SwapCallback(int256,int256,byte.notice: Uniswap v3 callback fn, called back on pool.swap
